title.narrative: Technical Assistance For The Implementation Of The New Urban Agenda In Reynosa, Mexico

description.narrative:
The objective of the project is to support the Municipal Government of Reynosa in the process of preparation of the Program of Territorial Planning and Urban Development of the Municipality so that it can be aligned with the New Urban Agenda.
Currently the municipality of Reynosa is in the process of updating the Program for Land Use Planning and Urban Development (POTDU) of the municipality, a binding instrument that will determine where and how the city will develop in the coming decades. This activity is expected to be completed by December 2018.
The POTDU has a particular importance, since it will guide the development of two close municipalities, Reynosa and Rio Bravo. This metropolitan planning area, while demanding a greater capacity for coordination, brings significant benefits for the spatial capital. According to an OECD study, in metropolitan areas fragmented into uncoordinated municipalities, there is a decrease in production levels by 5-6%. This negative effect is reduced by half when there is an entity or instrument of governance at the metropolitan level. Metropolitan coordination facilitates accessibility to social infrastructure, which results in greater inclusion and social cohesion.
Since 2011, the IMPLAN has been directing the municipal efforts of urban development and territorial planning and has the task of supporting the municipal government with the alignment of the planning instruments as well as the codes and regulations to the new federal regulations derived from the new Law of Human Settlements, Territorial Planning and Urban Development. Finally, the IMPLAN is responsible for generating conditions of social participation to strengthen the governance of urban development, through participatory processes and communication and dissemination campaigns to raise awareness and involve the citizens.
It is expected that provide assistance to the state administration could transmit experiences, practices and lessons previously learned, as well as the implementation of a dissemination and communication strategy, aimed at creating a bidirectional space for dialogue and dissemination of findings, progress and results of technical assistance. For this, it will contribute to the elaboration of messages so that the model of urban development proposed by the POT can be presented in an understandable way to the general public, elaborating a campaign that influences the public awareness on change and helps to form a supportive community.
